context: Tests whether the agent applies INVEST criteria validation, uses Given/When/Then for sequential onboarding steps, and emphasizes stakeholder alignment before finalizing acceptance criteria.

checklist.name: INVEST validation applied
checklist.description: Uses INVEST criteria (Independent, Negotiable, Valuable, Estimable, Small, Testable) to validate the user story

checklist.name: Given/When/Then sequences
checklist.description: Uses Given/When/Then format for multi-step onboarding workflow rather than rule-oriented format

checklist.name: Stakeholder alignment mention
checklist.description: References need for alignment with product owner, QA, and development team before implementation

checklist.name: Sequential step validation
checklist.description: Each step can be completed independently without unrelated dependencies (Independent criterion)

checklist.name: Testable binary criteria
checklist.description: Criteria have objective, binary pass/fail validation (Testable criterion)

checklist.name: User behavior scenarios
checklist.description: Scenario names describe user actions and behavior rather than system functionality

checklist.name: Business value emphasis
checklist.description: Clearly demonstrates user or business value in the story and criteria (Valuable criterion)

checklist.name: Estimable clarity
checklist.description: Requirements are clear enough for development team to estimate effort (Estimable criterion)

checklist.name: Single iteration scope
checklist.description: Story is scoped to be completable within one iteration (Small criterion)

checklist.name: Implementation flexibility
checklist.description: Allows for negotiable implementation details during development (Negotiable criterion)
